title: LinkedIn Business Highlights from Microsoft’s FY23 Q2 Earnings
description: Today, Microsoft announced Q2 FY23 Earnings. Included in the report on the financial performance were the following LinkedIn highlights:
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Transparency Report: First Half of 2022
description: Today we published our Transparency Report for the first half of 2022. The report covers government requests we received and action we took to remove fake accounts and content that violates our Professional Community Policies. Read the takeaways from the report in this share from Patrick Corrigan, VP of Legal - Digital Safety.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn wins hiQ lawsuit
description: Today, LinkedIn won a years-long battle against hiQ, which has agreed to a permanent injunction prohibiting it from scraping or using fake accounts on LinkedIn. Read more in this LinkedIn share from LinkedIn Vice President of Legal Sarah Wight.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Our Big Ideas for 2023
description: In March 2021, we saw the world opening up again and an unprecedented amount of movement in the labor market. Employees globally were rethinking not only how and where they work, but why and switching jobs at rates historically unseen.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: New analytics to understand your audience and grow on LinkedIn
description: When it comes to building a content strategy and growing your audience, we frequently hear from our creators how important it is to understand who you’re reaching and how your content is performing.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Our new and improved messaging experience for members
description: We’ve heard from many of our members that they want a better way to organize their LinkedIn Inbox. Today, we’re rolling out a new and improved LinkedIn messaging experience to make it easier for our members around the globe to find and respond to the messages that matter most.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Helping marketers prove their strategy is working
description: Marketers face an uphill climb. It’s getting harder for them to demonstrate the impact of their campaigns on revenue, given the long, group-based nature of the B2B purchase cycle. While 78% of marketing leaders believe that maintaining or increasing spend will accelerate their companies’ recovery amidst economic uncertainty, it’s going to be a battle to justify their budget if they can’t map their efforts to results.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Court order affirms LinkedIn’s legal positions against hiQ in data scraping case
description: Today in the hiQ case the Court ruled that LinkedIn may enforce its User Agreement against data scraping and fake accounts. Read more about the court’s order in this share from lead attorney Sarah Wight.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Our 2022 Workforce Diversity Report
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Making internal mobility and career development easier for talent professionals
description: Our CEO Ryan Roslansky delivered a keynote address today to global talent leaders at our 11th annual Talent Connect Summit. He discussed how organizations are adapting their talent strategies to pull through growing economic uncertainty. The key to success: fostering a culture of internal hiring and career development.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn Business Highlights from Microsoft’s FY23 Q1 Earnings
description: Today, Microsoft announced Q1 FY23 Earnings. Included in the report on the financial performance were the following LinkedIn highlights:
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: 2022 State of the Latino Workforce Report
description: Today we released data that sheds light on the barriers Latino professionals continue to face in the workplace today. As we work to build a more inclusive workforce for all, we hope these insights provide a path forward and help companies create cultures that not only accept but fully encourage all professionals to bring their authentic selves to work.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn Business Highlights from Microsoft’s FY22 Q4 Earnings
description: Today, Microsoft announced Q4 FY22 Earnings. Included in the report on the financial performance were the following LinkedIn highlights:
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Acquisition of EduBrite to further our skills-first vision
description: Today, we announced that we have entered into an agreement to acquire EduBrite, a platform that specializes in creating, hosting and deploying professional certificates.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: B2Brilliant: Our highlights from Cannes Lions 2022
description: This week, industry leaders from around the globe gathered at the Cannes Lions International Festival of Creativity to discuss the future of the ad industry and celebrate creative excellence. Our CEO Ryan Roslansky and CMCO Mel Selcher were among those in attendance, sharing our unique insights and perspectives on the opportunities ahead for B2B brands.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Exciting new tools for creators
description: To help support the amazing creator activity happening on LinkedIn, we’re excited to announce more tools and features to help creators build an engaged audience and foster meaningful relationships with their followers. Here is what’s new:
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: The State of LGBTQ+ Workforce 2022
description: Showing support for the LGBTQ+ workforce year-round is more important than ever as more of the U.S. population identifies as a member of the LGBTQ+ and at a time of increased violence against transgender people and discrimination with nearly 240 anti-LGBTQ bills filed in 2022 alone.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Introducing new services and products built for B2B
description: B2B brands power much of the world’s economy, and as the B2B space continues to garner more attention, the stage is set for a creative revolution. The companies that are ready to meet the moment and join the revolution will have the advantage as it takes off.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Keeping our members safe
description: Creating a fake account is a clear violation of our terms of service. Our Threat Intelligence team actively seeks out signs of state sponsored activity and removes fake accounts using information we uncover, and intelligence from a variety of sources, including government agencies. Our Transparency Report sets out the actions that we take to keep LinkedIn a safe place where real people can connect with professionals they know and trust, including that 97% of the fake accounts we removed were blocked at registration. We welcome the continued efforts in the UK of the Centre for the Protection of National Infrastructure.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn stops company from scraping millions of LinkedIn member profiles
description: Today LinkedIn took another step forward in its fight against unauthorized data scraping by successfully resolving the lawsuit it filed against Singapore-based company Mantheos Ptd. Ltd on February 1, 2022. As part of the resolution, Mantheos agreed to permanently delete all scraped LinkedIn member profile data, destroy all software it used to scrape LinkedIn profiles, and stop  accessing LinkedIn member profile data through scraping or other automated means.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: An update from LinkedIn
description: Today LinkedIn reached a settlement with the U.S. Department of Labor’s Office of Federal Contractor Compliance Programs, following a routine compliance review of compensation practices. The agency claimed that between 2015 and 2017, we paid some female employees in California inconsistently with their peers. While we have agreed to settle this matter, we do not agree with the government’s claims; LinkedIn pays and has paid its employees fairly and equitably when comparing similar work.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn Business Highlights from Microsoft’s FY22 Q3 Earnings
description: Yesterday, Microsoft announced Q3 FY22 Earnings. Included in the report on the financial performance were the following LinkedIn highlights:
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: New tools for creators on LinkedIn
description: Last year we rolled out Creator Mode on LinkedIn and since then, more than 5.5 million people across the globe turned on the feature to establish their voice, unlock new opportunities, and build an engaged audience.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Our skills-first vision for the future
description: Our CEO Ryan Roslansky shared an article today about our company’s unique opportunity to help create a skills-first economy that meets the moment.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: A new way to represent career breaks on LinkedIn
description: Today, we’re introducing a new way to represent a career break in the Experience section of the LinkedIn Profile, with 13 options including caregiving, and health and well-being. By adding a career break to your Profile, you can stand out to hirers by highlighting how these life experiences can apply to prospective jobs: 51% of hirers say they are more likely to contact a candidate that provides context about their career break.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Acquisition of Oribi to accelerate attribution technology capabilities and establish new office in Israel
description: Today, we announced that we have entered into an agreement to acquire Oribi, an Israel-based marketing analytics company, to further help our customers, from marketers to recruiters, gain actionable insights, make smarter decisions, and drive business results. Through the integration of Oribi’s technology into our marketing solutions platform, our customers will benefit from enhanced campaign attribution to optimize the ROI of their advertising strategies.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Our 2022 Global Green Skills Report
description: Today, we will release our first ever report on the state of the green economy. The 2022 Global Green Skills Report shines a light on how and where people are contributing to the transition to a green economy, where gaps are emerging, and what policymakers, companies and individuals can do to help fight the climate crisis.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Glint to become part of Microsoft Viva
description: Today, we announced that Glint, a part of LinkedIn and the market leader in employee engagement, will become part of Viva, Microsoft's employee experience platform, in 2023. With Glint joining the Viva family, Microsoft’s vision is to bring feedback directly into the flow of work to ensure managers have an easy way to access employee engagement insights and respond to their team’s needs.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Taking legal action to protect members against scraping
description: Recently, we’ve shared more about how LinkedIn works to combat scraping abuse including defining the universe of unauthorized activity, how we protect our members, and some of the technical measures we employ to prevent abuse on our platform. Another way we work to keep our members and their data safe is by taking legal action against those that cause harm on our platform.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn for Journalists: Join us on March 2nd
description: Calling all journalists: our next LinkedIn for Journalists session will take place March 2 at 9 a.m. PT on LinkedIn Live, and we’ll cover the latest product updates, tips, and data about “The Great Reshuffle.” Applications are due by February 14 at 5 p.m. PT, so apply today.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn Business Highlights from Microsoft’s FY22 Q2 Earnings
description: Yesterday, Microsoft announced Q2 FY22 Earnings. Included in the report on the financial performance were the following LinkedIn highlights:
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Our 2022 Global Talent Trends Report
description: What matters to employees — and how employers are responding — is changing in a big way. In fact, company culture is having a watershed moment that’s redefining the relationship between employers and employees.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: An update on reports of scraped data
description: Unauthorized scraping is against our policies and every day teams at LinkedIn are working hard to keep our members and their information safe. When anyone tries to take member data and use it for purposes LinkedIn and our members haven’t agreed to, we work to stop them and hold them accountable.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Introducing InCareer: LinkedIn's new app to help professionals in China find jobs
description: Today we announced that we're taking the first step in our new strategy for China with the launch of InCareer, a new jobs app designed to help Chinese mainland professionals find jobs and companies discover great talent in China. You can read more about the news in our corporate blog.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Future of work: Our predictions for 2022
description: We’re in the midst of one of the biggest transformations the world of work has ever seen, what we’re calling the Great Reshuffle. People are reevaluating what work means to them, while companies are rethinking entire working models, cultures, and company values.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn launches in Hindi to boost access to opportunities for 600 million people
description: LinkedIn, the world’s largest professional network, today marked a new milestone with the launch of Hindi, the first Indian regional language on LinkedIn, with the goal to support 600 million Hindi language speakers globally. With this launch, LinkedIn aims to break down language barriers, providing greater access to professional and networking opportunities to Hindi speakers in India and around the world. With the launch of Hindi, LinkedIn now supports 25 languages globally.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn Business Highlights from Microsoft’s FY22 Q1 Earnings
description: Yesterday, Microsoft announced Q1 FY22 Earnings. Included in the report on the financial performance were the following LinkedIn highlights:
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Our 2021 Workforce Diversity Report
description: At LinkedIn, we are building a more diverse and inclusive company where all talent thrives. We envision a workforce that reflects the communities we serve, and diversity, inclusion, and belonging (DIBs) remain our number one talent priority. Over the past 12 months we’ve made significant investments, and we’re seeing advances across our DIBS strategy globally. In this year’s workforce diversity report, we’re sharing an update on our progress with a mix of enthusiasm for the momentum we have established and deep humility in recognizing that we have more work to do.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: China: sunset of localized version of LinkedIn and launch of new InJobs app later this year
description: Today we announced an update on our strategy in China. You can read more about the news in our corporate blog.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: An update on LinkedIn China
description: While we remain focused on creating economic opportunity for our members in China, we're temporarily pausing new member sign-ups to our LinkedIn App in China to ensure we remain in compliance with local law. We’re a global platform with an obligation to respect the local laws that apply to us.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: The future of work at LinkedIn
description: Today we shared an update on the future of work at LinkedIn. For more information, check out posts from Ryan and Teuila on our platform.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn Business Highlights from Microsoft’s FY21 Q4 Earnings
description: Yesterday, Microsoft announced Q4 FY21 Earnings. Included in the report on the financial performance were the following LinkedIn highlights:
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: The Government of Ontario taps LinkedIn to help people get back to work
description: Over the past year the global pandemic has disrupted the lives of workers and global economies. In Ontario, Canada specifically, it’s been devastating to see over 400,000 people lose their jobs, with the youth unemployment rate hovering around a staggering 17.2%.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: An update on report of scraped data
description: Our teams have investigated a set of alleged LinkedIn data that has been posted for sale. We want to be clear that this is not a data breach and no private LinkedIn member data was exposed. Our initial investigation has found that this data was scraped from LinkedIn and other various websites and includes the same data reported earlier this year in our April 2021 scraping update.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn joins Digital Trust & Safety Partnership
description: Today we announced our participation in the Digital Trust & Safety Partnership, a first-of-its-kind initiative to create a safer and more trustworthy internet. We will join Discord, Facebook, Inc., Google, Microsoft, Patreon, Pinterest, Reddit, Shopify, Twitter, and Vimeo, in developing industry best practices, reviewed through internal and independent third-party assessments, to ensure member safety.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: An update from LinkedIn Learning
description: This month, our three year transition from lynda.com to LinkedIn Learning comes to an end. We’ve used this time to work closely with our customers, including libraries transitioning to our new product for libraries, to create a seamless experience with learning history, certificates, and playlists all being automatically transferred over to LinkedIn Learning.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Our 2021 Grad’s Guide to Getting Hired
description: If you’re a new graduate starting your job search, there’s good news about the job market: we’re on the road to economic recovery from COVID-19 and the future looks bright. In fact, there are millions of open entry-level jobs in the U.S listed on LinkedIn right now.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn Business Highlights from Microsoft’s FY21 Q3 Earnings
description: Yesterday, Microsoft announced Q3 FY21 Earnings. Included in the report on the financial performance were the following LinkedIn highlights:
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: 2021 Opportunity Index for Asia Pacific
description: Today, we published our LinkedIn Opportunity Index 2021 for Asia Pacific. The study illuminates many of the goals and perceived barriers members are currently experiencing across the region amid COVID-19.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Creating trusted connections
description: We welcome the online safety efforts of the Centre for the Protection of National Infrastructure and its work to expand their Think Before You Link campaign in the United Kingdom. Teams at LinkedIn work to keep LinkedIn a safe place where real people can connect with professionals they know and trust.  We actively seek out signs of state sponsored activity on the platform and quickly take action against bad actors in order to protect our members. Our Threat Intelligence team removes fake accounts using information we uncover and intelligence from a variety of sources, including government agencies. Our teams utilize multiple automated techniques, coupled with human reviews and member reporting to maintain LinkedIn as a safe and trusted platform. And we enforce our policies, which are very clear: fraudulent activity with an intent to mislead or lie to our members is a violation of our terms of service.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: An update on report of scraped data
description: Members trust LinkedIn with their data, and we take action to protect that trust. We have investigated an alleged set of LinkedIn data that has been posted for sale and have determined that it is actually an aggregation of data from a number of websites and companies. It does include publicly viewable member profile data that appears to have been scraped from LinkedIn. This was not a LinkedIn data breach, and no private member account data from LinkedIn was included in what we’ve been able to review.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn and Microsoft Commit to Helping 250,000 Companies Hire for Skills
description: Today, we are expanding the work of our global skills initiative with Microsoft to launch new resources that will help job seekers and employers move to a skills-based economy.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Our commitment to equal pay
description: Senior Vice President and Chief People Officer Teuila Hanson shared the following update today on LinkedIn about our commitment to equal pay:
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: An update on LinkedIn China
description: While we remain focused on our goal of creating economic opportunity for our members in China, we're temporarily pausing new member sign-ups for LinkedIn China as we work to ensure we remain in compliance with local law. We’re a global platform with an obligation to respect the laws that apply to us, including adhering to Chinese government regulations for our localized version of LinkedIn in China.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Reskilling and upskilling is the top priority for L&D pros globally
description: Today, LinkedIn Learning released its 5th annual Workplace Learning Report, highlighting new trends for the state of the Learning & Development (L&D) industry, the skills needed for the new world of work, and learner engagement in hybrid workplaces.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn restored after site outage
description: LinkedIn was down today due to a configuration change in our internal systems. We’ve restored service and appreciate the patience while we got everything back up.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: An update from LinkedIn Learning
description: Conversations about race are hard, but critical. We've seen a strong interest in content to help advance understanding of diversity, inclusion and belonging in our professional lives and offer more than 270 courses on these topics. We believe learning is critical to ensuring that all people, regardless of demographics, have equal access to opportunity. Not all of them will resonate, and different perspectives are important. With that said, the “Confronting Racism” course has been removed based on a request from the author and the 3rd party content provider who created the content, as it does not accurately capture the messages the author intended. We will continue to ensure we provide a breadth of learning content to help people learn the skills they need to be more successful in their career.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Introducing LinkedIn Integrations with New Microsoft Viva Employee Experience Platform
description: Today, we’re introducing new Glint and LinkedIn Learning integrations with Microsoft Viva, a new Employee Experience Platform designed to help people learn, grow, and thrive at work. These integrations bring managers visibility into how their people are feeling in their jobs and give employees access to learning opportunities all within their daily Microsoft 365 and Teams workflow.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn Business Highlights from Microsoft’s FY21 Q2 Earnings
description: Yesterday, Microsoft announced Q2 FY21 Earnings. Included in the report on the financial performance were the following LinkedIn highlights:
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Our leadership updates
description: Entering 2021, LinkedIn is continuing to see record levels of engagement from our more than 722 million members as they use our platform to connect, learn and find new opportunities. We’re also seeing companies around the globe continue to turn to our platform to grow their businesses.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: An update on LinkedIn in Turkey
description: LinkedIn has agreed to comply with a provision of the new Turkish Internet law that requires the appointment of a local representative. It’s our responsibility to give our members a safe and trusted platform to find a job, stay informed, and learn new skills, and we will continue to be open about how we make decisions to build the professional community they expect. We're not changing our Terms of Service or Professional Community Policies and will keep publishing how we handle government requests. We will continue to monitor the situation closely.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Get hired this year: 2021’s fastest-growing jobs, and the skills you need to get them
description: The COVID-19 pandemic has permanently changed the jobs landscape so understanding what “comes next” is top of mind for employers and job seekers alike as the global labor market begins to recover. Today, following our joint commitment with Microsoft to help get 25 million people back to work, LinkedIn announced new insights that shed light on what’s next as we enter the new year.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: New product gives sales operations teams access to real-time data at scale
description: Today we are introducing LinkedIn Sales Insights, a new product in the LinkedIn Sales Solutions portfolio that is powered by over 722 million members on LinkedIn to help Sales Operations teams identify and size potential opportunities, get a clearer view of the market, and plan more confidently.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Helping jobseekers take their next step
description: Today, we’re rolling out new insights and tools to help job seekers take the next step in their career. A post on our LinkedIn blog today from our head of product, Tomer Cohen, gives a full overview of this news.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn Business Highlights from Microsoft’s FY21 Q1 Earnings
description: Yesterday, Microsoft announced Q1 FY21 Earnings. Included in the report on the financial performance were the following LinkedIn highlights:
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Our Global Flexible Work Policy
description: As we continue to monitor the impact of COVID-19 globally, protecting our workforce remains the number one guiding principle driving all of our return to office decisions.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Our 2020 Workforce Diversity Report
description: Today, we published our annual workforce diversity report. As an organization that exists to create economic opportunity for the entire global workforce, we recognize the responsibility we have to help build that future, both within our workforce and for our hundreds of millions of members and customers. In the long-term, this means building towards a world where professional organizations are a reflection of the communities in which they operate.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: New design and experiences help members build meaningful relationships
description: Today, we’re announcing the redesign of LinkedIn — from the inside out — to continue to help you connect with your community and make your LinkedIn experience as easy, enjoyable, safe, and inclusive as possible. A post on our LinkedIn blog today from our CEO Ryan Roslansky gives a full overview of this news.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: UAE female hiring recovers after initial drop during COVID-19
description: Lockdown measures put in place to contain the spread of COVID-19 led to a drastic drop in female hiring in April 2020, before recovering in June and July as restrictions were gradually lifted, according to a new data from LinkedIn.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Digital library leader Scribd has acquired SlideShare
description: Today, we’re announcing that digital library leader Scribd has acquired LinkedIn’s SlideShare.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: How we're working to keep our community safe, trusted, and professional
description: On August 12, LinkedIn and other technology companies participated in regular meetings with the U.S. government to coordinate on election security. We released the following joint statement:
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Our commitment to a zero waste future
description: Today, LinkedIn announced its Zero Waste commitment as part of the third phase of Microsoft's global sustainability initiative to protect and preserve our global ecosystem for future generations. Our ambitious goal to eliminate waste by 2030 is the third sprint in a broader commitment launched earlier this year focusing on carbon, water, ecosystems and waste.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn Business Highlights from Microsoft’s FY20 Q4 Earnings
description: Yesterday, Microsoft announced Q4 FY20 earnings. Included in the report on the financial performance were the following LinkedIn highlights:
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Reducing the number of roles in our Global Sales and Talent Acquisition organizations
description: Today, we shared the difficult news with our employees that we are reducing the number of roles in our sales and talent acquisition teams by approximately 960 roles, representing 6% of our company. This is in no way a reflection of the incredible talent that these employees possess, but instead a reflection of how we are evolving the business to better support our members and customers.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: New tool helps LinkedIn members pronounce names correctly
description: Correct pronunciation is not just a common courtesy — it’s an important part of making a good first impression and creating an inclusive workplace. That’s why we decided to provide a feature that gives you the option to share how to pronounce your name.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn and Microsoft help 25 million job seekers get back to work
description: Today, we, as part of the Microsoft ecosystem, are launching a global skills initiative aimed at helping 25 million people who have become unemployed due to the COVID-19 pandemic and resulting economic crisis get the skills they need to land their next job.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn survey reveals insights on the economic impact of COVID-19 on LGBTQ+ professionals
description: To understand the impact of COVID-19 on, and the level of support for, the LGBTQ+ community at work, we conducted a survey to more than 1,000 LGBTQ+ professionals in the U.S. The key findings below highlight that the LGBTQ+ community is facing high unemployment due to COVID-19, and while many professionals have made the decision to come out at work and do feel supported, there is still a lot of work left to be done.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Learning cements its strategic position in the workplace, with 70% of CEOs championing its value
description: Today, LinkedIn Learning released its Leading with Learning report, highlighting how our new reality has cemented workplace learning’s strategic position within an organization, both functionally and culturally.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn Learning and Glint integration to help managers better connect with employees
description: As people continue to adapt to the new rhythm of work and today’s environment, managers will play an even bigger role in employee success. That’s why today we are announcing LinkedIn Learning for Glint. The new integration will embed over 100 expert-curated LinkedIn Learning videos directly into Glint’s action taking capabilities to help managers learn specific skills, and take action on team feedback more effectively.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn Business Highlights from Microsoft’s FY20 Q3 Earnings
description: Yesterday, Microsoft announced Q3 FY20 earnings. Included in the report on the financial performance were the following LinkedIn highlights:

description: Today, LinkedIn’s Head of LinkedIn For Nonprofits, Ariana Younai, shared a post announcing a new offering for nonprofit organizations looking to take their fundraising efforts digital during coronavirus. We’re sharing her full post here as well:

title: LinkedIn announces Video Intro and AI-powered interview feedback to help job seekers and hirers
description: Given the need to adapt to more virtual hiring practices, today, we announced two features that will help hirers get to know candidates better and faster while providing job seekers with a new way to refine their virtual interview skills.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: How COVID-19 is impacting hiring around the world
description: Today, LinkedIn's Chief Economist, Karin Kimbrough, shared a post about the impact of COVID-19 on hiring globally. We’re sharing her full post here as well:
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: In This Together: Sharing Our COVID-19 Learnings
description: Today, LinkedIn’s Chief Marketing & Communications Officer, Melissa Selcher, shared a post about what our team has learned about COVID-19 so far, and how we're thinking about the path ahead. We’re sharing her full post here as well:
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: COVID-19 joint industry statement
description: LinkedIn has joined Microsoft, Facebook, Google, Reddit, Twitter and Youtube in a joint industry statement on COVID-19.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: This week: COVID-19 insights and resources
description: Since the coronavirus emerged, LinkedIn, like many other organizations, has worked through how we protect our workforce, customers and communities. Each week, we’re sharing resources to help our community stay informed, connected, and productive as coronavirus continues to impact our daily lives.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Resources to help navigate work and coronavirus
description: Today, LinkedIn’s Senior VP of Product, Ryan Rolansky, shared a post about how LinkedIn is helping people adjust and thrive in a different normal. We’re sharing his full post here as well:
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Glint 360s will help organizations develop leaders at scale
description: New research shows us that 86% of professionals on LinkedIn agree it’s crucial to get feedback from more people than just their manager,  and 89% agree that receiving actionable feedback helps them grow at work. That’s why Glint today announced the launch of Glint 360s, a modern approach to accelerating leadership development and to making feedback accessible, insightful, and actionable. Built to accompany Glint Engage and Glint Perform, Glint 360s empower individuals to create development goals that sit alongside their business and other goals, resulting in a connected experience across employee engagement, performance, and development.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: International Women's Day 2020
description: To celebrate International Women’s Day, LinkedIn is shedding light on the barriers mothers face when returning to work after taking a career break and how organizations can learn how to better support women through this transition.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Colombian National Learning Service taps LinkedIn to close skills gaps
description: Half a million Colombian students, teachers, and employees now have access to online learning courses that will help them build vital technical and soft skills through a new agreement between SENA (Colombian National Learning Service) and LinkedIn Learning. Together, SENA, Microsoft, and LinkedIn will help prepare Colombian workers to thrive in the digital economy and create new pathways to opportunity for the nation’s workforce.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Age is a key barrier to work opportunities for people: LinkedIn Opportunity Index
description: LinkedIn, the world’s largest professional network, has launched LinkedIn Opportunity Index 2020 today. The Index is a composite measure that seeks to understand how people perceive opportunity and more importantly, the gaps in getting to those opportunities. The research surveyed over 30,000 respondents in 22 markets globally.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Ryan Roslansky to become CEO and Jeff Weiner to move into Executive Chairman role on June 1
description: LinkedIn’s vision is to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce and we continue to make progress in realizing it. Our 675 million members, up from 610 million a year ago, are engaging on LinkedIn at record levels to grow their careers, stay informed and connect with their communities. Our customers, who helped grow our trailing twelve month revenue to $7.5B, are leveraging LinkedIn’s talent, marketing, sales and learning products to grow their companies.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn Business Highlights from Microsoft’s FY20 Q2 Earnings
description: Yesterday, Microsoft announced Q2 FY20 earnings. Included in the report on the financial performance were the following LinkedIn highlights:
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn Pages and Elevate -- Better Together
description: LinkedIn Pages and Elevate have enabled organizations to interact at scale with the people who matter most to their business and tell their brand stories in ways not possible anywhere else. Over the last four years, hundreds of our customers have used Elevate to help their employees be brand advocates. At the same time, these customers -- and over 50 million more organizations -- have worked to build their LinkedIn Page so they could engage their most important audiences.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn reveals four trends reshaping how companies hire and retain talent in 2020
description: Today, LinkedIn released our 10th annual Global Talent Trends report. The headline? Empathy is the superpower that will help companies find the most value amid changing expectations from employees in an increasingly tight labor market.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Committing to carbon negative by 2030
description: LinkedIn is proud to be part of Microsoft's commitment to be carbon negative by 2030. We’re committed to ambitious goals and a new plan to reduce and ultimately remove our carbon footprint. This includes:
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: New research shows how leaders should be preparing for the future of work
description: Today we’re sharing the findings of a 14,000-person LinkedIn member survey conducted in partnership with Jacob Morgan, futurist and author of upcoming book The Future Leader, that identifies the skills, mindsets, trends, and challenges future leaders will need to adapt to over the next 10 years.

title: LinkedIn raises employee donation match to 15K annually
description: Over the past year, thousands of LinkedIn employees have supported organizations and causes that they care about with their time or financial resources.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: New LinkedIn data predicts three factors that make employees stay in their role longer
description: It’s no secret that employee turnover is expensive. Earlier this year, a Gallup Poll reported the cost of turnover to be $1 trillion. Factor in leadership time, loss of momentum, customer relationships--  the dollars rise and the impact expands. It’s clear that companies need to make a proactive investment in retention.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Our 2019 Workforce Diversity Report
description: Today, LinkedIn published the 2019 Workforce Diversity Report. Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging is our number one talent priority at LinkedIn and we are focused on ensuring that employees from all backgrounds are successful, especially groups that have been underrepresented. By building a diverse team — from top to bottom — with different perspectives we believe we can foster unparalleled innovation and accelerate the realization of LinkedIn’s vision of creating economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce. This work is at the core of everything we do, and though we are proud of the progress we’ve made with Women, we acknowledge that we should be doing better, and moving  faster, especially with Black and Latino representation.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Our Professional Community Policies
description: Our members place their trust in us, and expect and deserve a safe and trusted community where they can express themselves professionally.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: 2019 Veteran Opportunity Report reveals insights on an overlooked talent pool
description: Today, LinkedIn released the Veteran Opportunity Report. The report takes an in-depth look at the real challenges facing veterans as they enter the job market and suggests solutions for how to fix this hiring gap for recruiters and hiring managers.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn announces a new office in Mexico, expanding its investments in Latin America
description: LinkedIn, the world's largest professional network, announced today the opening of its first office in Mexico City in 2020, with the main goal of growing its business in the country. Mexico is one of LinkedIn’s fastest growing markets in Latin America and home to our seventh largest member base worldwide. This new office will be the company’s second in Latin America and one of the 30 offices LinkedIn has around the world.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: The demand for recruiting professionals has increased by 63%, and expectations for the role shift everyday
description: Today, LinkedIn released the Future of Recruiting report, based on survey responses from thousands of members of the global talent community, billions of LinkedIn data points, and interviews with talent leaders.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn Rolls Out Dynamic Type for iOS users and Automatic Image Descriptions
description: Our teams are constantly working to improve the LinkedIn experience, and today we are introducing two new improvements to make it easier for all of our members to use LinkedIn.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn Business Highlights from Microsoft’s FY20 Q1 Earnings
description: Microsoft announced their Q1 FY20 earnings yesterday. In their report on the company’s financial performance, they shared LinkedIn highlights including:
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn opens new community space for local Bay Area nonprofits
description: Today, LinkedIn is excited to announce the opening of a new community space, InCommon, in its downtown San Francisco office. The space will provide critical programming, meeting, and event space at no cost for Bay Area nonprofits focused on removing barriers to opportunity for underserved communities.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Homeownership is more than a dream for software engineers in these major U.S. metros
description: The idea of affordable housing and San Francisco are about as compatible as oil and water.  Despite tech’s insatiable appetite for software engineering talent driving median salaries to nearly $200,000 a year, it remains nearly impossible for people to afford to purchase a home in a market where the median prices have reached nearly $1,400,000.
author: Jenny Ying

title: LinkedIn Business Momentum Highlights from Talent Connect
description: At LinkedIn Talent Connect conference in Dallas, TX last week, LinkedIn CEO Jeff Weiner shared an update on how we are serving our members and customers, and how we are working to accelerate the realization of our vision of creating economic opportunity for every professional.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn Announces New Updates Moving the Company Beyond Recruiting
description: Our annual Talent Connect conference turns ten this year, and today we shared several updates on LinkedIn’s talent business, our vision and product roadmap.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn announces Skill Assessments to help professionals showcase and improve skills
description: At LinkedIn, we want everyone to have access to opportunities based on the skills they have, regardless of their background or where they went to school. That’s why we’re excited to roll out LinkedIn Skill Assessments.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: New LinkedIn Research Explores the Shift Toward Skills-Based Hiring
description: As the modern workplace evolves, finding the talent your company truly needs to thrive can be difficult. First off, the skills we need to succeed in the modern workforce are not static. In fact, the most in-demand occupations and specialties did not exist ten years ago, and the pace of change is only accelerating.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: New Language Matters Gender Diversity Report
description: Today, LinkedIn released the new report, Language Matters: How Words Impact Men and Women in the Workplace. The report takes an in-depth look at how the words different genders use to describe themselves, could impact their experiences at work and during the hiring process.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Building the next version of our infrastructure
description: The pursuit of our mission to connect the world’s professionals to make them more productive and successful is deeply dependent on the technology and infrastructure we build and maintain. We’ve seen incredible member and business momentum and to scale to meet future business needs, we have decided to begin a multi-year migration of all LinkedIn workloads to the public cloud. In recent years we’ve leveraged a number of Azure technologies in ways that have had a notable impact on our business. That success, coupled with the opportunity to leverage the relationship we’ve built with Microsoft, made Azure the obvious choice.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: What's in your LinkedIn Feed: People You Know, Talking About Things You Care About
description: We have a saying at LinkedIn: “People You Know, Talking About Things You Care About.” This is, simply, how we think about the LinkedIn Feed.
author: Pete Davies

title: The LinkedIn Brand: Finding our Voice and Showing our Colors
description: More and more people are commenting to me that LinkedIn feels different. The sentiment is positive and they talk about seeing us more in the world, finding more value and inspiration in their experience on the platform, and feeling a warmer, friendlier vibe from our brand. And then last month, BrandZ named LinkedIn as one of the top 10 fastest growing brands in the U.S., growing over 41% in one year, adding over $6B in value. What’s happening is real, and we’re excited to tell the story.
author: Melissa Selcher

title: Accelerating our Marketing Solutions Technology Platform
description: To accelerate the capabilities of our LinkedIn Marketing Solutions technology platform and further help businesses reach, engage and convert their professional audiences at scale, LinkedIn has entered into an agreement to acquire Drawbridge, Inc., a San Mateo, CA based technology company. We plan to integrate Drawbridge’s technology into our marketing solutions portfolio to help our customers better reach and understand their professional audiences and measure the ROI of their campaigns. We will not be disclosing the financial terms of the deal.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn’s New Jobs and Hiring Features Creates Better Matches
description: Today, we announced several new jobs and hiring features, including new Instant Job Alerts, which is making finding the right jobs simpler, and the availability of our new Recruiter and Jobs platform, which is making it more efficient for hiring managers to hire quality candidates.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: What our team is doing to keep LinkedIn safe
description: Today, LinkedIn’s Head of Trust & Safety, Paul Rockwell, shared a post about what our team is doing to keep LinkedIn safe. We’re sharing his full post here as well:
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: One in three professionals in India are ‘career sleepwalking’: LinkedIn study
description: India, March 26, 2019: Today professionals in India are changing jobs and careers more than ever before and the days of a linear career path or life-long employment at a company are no longer the norm. LinkedIn’s new Career Pathways survey finds that one in three Indian professionals feel like they are ‘career sleepwalking’ - they feel stagnant as though they are on a treadmill going nowhere, and 57% would consider career pivoting in order to build a more fulfilling career. However, an impact on their pay packets and designation is deterring close to 51% of professionals from making the switch.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn Detroit has a new home
description: In October 2017, LinkedIn joined the thriving business community in Detroit, MI. While we started this journey in a temporary space, our intention was to find and open a new and permanent office where we could grow and become a true part of the community. Today we’re excited to be opening the doors of our new office at 1515 Woodward Ave.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Glint announces enhancements to people success platform to develop stronger leaders
description: Today, Glint, a leader in employee engagement acquired by LinkedIn, announced three new manager empowerment capabilities to help leaders thrive and create motivated and happy teams. Designed using Glint’s AI-for-HR™and real-time engagement technology, these new features eliminate tedious manual analysis, automatically find patterns, and identify a manager’s most significant areas of opportunity to create more engaged teams:
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn releases new report showcasing how gender impacts the candidate journey
description: Today, LinkedIn released a new Gender Insights Report to shed light on how women and men engage with jobs differently on the LinkedIn platform.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: An Update from the LinkedIn Product Team
description: At LinkedIn, our mission is to connect the world’s professionals to make them more productive and successful. At the center of this global professional community is the LinkedIn Feed: a place for our members to discover and join the conversations that are happening among their connections, taking place within their groups, and ignited by the topics, people, and organizations they’re following. A feature that helps start these conversations is Mentioned in the News, which identifies members mentioned in a news article and then notifies them, their connections and their followers.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn Releases 2019 Workplace Learning Report
description: Today, LinkedIn released the 2019 Workplace Learning Report, an annual survey of talent developers and learners, that identifies key trends in the learning and development industry.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn announces the rebuild of three core talent tools to one platform
description: Today, LinkedIn announced plans to move its core hiring tools -- LinkedIn Recruiter, LinkedIn Jobs and Pipeline Builder -- on one single platform called the New Recruiter and Jobs.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn Releases 2019 Global Talent Trends Report
description: Today, LinkedIn released the 2019 Global Talent Trends report, an annual survey of hiring professionals which helps to inform how HR, talent acquisition and business leaders should approach their recruiting strategies for the coming year.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn signs new office lease with plans to double workforce in Omaha
description: Today, we’re excited to announce that LinkedIn has signed a lease to relocate our Omaha office to Sterling Ridge at Pacific St. & S 132nd St. With construction beginning later this year, our current Omaha employees will begin moving to the new space in 2021.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: January LinkedIn U.S. Workforce Report: Business Skills Surge in Importance in Traditional Finance Hubs
description: In the first monthly Workforce Report of 2019, we looked at the rising demand of business management skills in traditional finance hubs. Business management skills - such as strategy, vendor management, and change management - have increased in demand and are becoming relatively more important in traditional finance hubs such as New York, Chicago, Boston and Philadelphia. At the same time, finance-related skills have become relatively less important in these regions over the same time period.

title: Career advancement, entrepreneurship and learning opportunities matter most to people in Asia Pacific, but financial security and networks stand in the way: LinkedIn
description: Singapore, 28 November 2018 – LinkedIn, the world’s largest professional network has just revealed its inaugural LinkedIn Opportunity Index in the Asia Pacific (APAC) region where it has more than 153 million members. The Index is a composite measure that seeks to understand how people perceive opportunity and more importantly, barriers that may prevent them from getting to those opportunities. The research surveyed over 11,000 respondents in nine markets in the Asia Pacific region - Australia, Chinese Mainland, Hong Kong, India, Indonesia, Japan, Malaysia, the Philippines, and Singapore.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn Closes on Acquisition of Glint: Helping Leaders Build Winning Teams
description: November 16, 2018 - Today we’re excited to announce that we have closed on the acquisition of Glint, a leader in employee engagement that helps people in organizations do their best work, develop their skills, and improve business results. Glint’s insights into people success, along with LinkedIn’s insights into the broader workforce, will be a powerful combination that can help talent leaders attract, develop, and retain the best talent.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn's 2018 Workforce Diversity Report
description: Today we published our 2018 Workforce Diversity Report. Our 2018 report shows sustained progress in some areas, particularly in gender representation. Women now represent 39.1% of our company’s leadership. That’s an increase of 12% in the last two years, and 49% in the last four. We’ve also seen gender diversity improve across technical roles globally. Our full report and strategy can be found here.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn Pages to include Crunchbase insights
description: Today, we formally announced LinkedIn Pages -- the next generation of LinkedIn Company Pages. Pages have been rebuilt from the ground up to make it easier for brands, institutions and organizations - from small businesses to large enterprises, to foster meaningful conversations with LinkedIn’s community of more than 590 million members. Learn more about the launch on our LinkedIn Marketing Solutions blog.

title: Removing Nation-State Activity from Our Platform
description: Today, LinkedIn’s Head of Trust & Safety, Paul Rockwell, shared a post about removing nation-state activity from our platform. We’re sharing his full post here as well:
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn Announces new Recruiter platform, it's first ATS and new diversity insights at Talent Connect Conference
description: Today at our ninth annual Talent Connect conference, we announced several new products and features to help talent leaders navigate today's digital transformation, against a backdrop of the growing skills shortage and fierce competition for talent and getting hired.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn Announces Intent to Acquire Employee Engagement Leader Glint
description: Today, we’re announcing that LinkedIn has signed an agreement to acquire Glint, a leader in employee engagement, that delivers an enterprise-grade platform designed to help organizations do their best work, develop their skills, and improve business results. Based in Redwood City with offices in London, U.K and Lincoln, Nebraska, Glint has more than 300+ customers globally that have adopted Glint’s enterprise-grade AI-driven approach.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: UK LinkedIn Workforce Report: How the finance workforce is changing
description: LinkedIn’s September UK Workforce Report reveals changes to Financial Services workforce, ten years on from the financial crisis, and more than two years on from the Brexit vote.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Our commitment to closing the gender gap(s)
description: Two years ago, we committed to increasing the representation of women in leadership positions at LinkedIn, and we’ve made progress. At the same time, we reaffirmed our commitment to pay equity across the company. You can read more about our commitment to equal representation here.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: An Update on Nation-State Activity
description: We're committed to keeping LinkedIn a safe, trusted and professional community. Our policies are very clear: the creation of fake accounts or any fraudulent activity, which includes an intent to mislead or lie to our members, is a violation of LinkedIn's terms of service.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: An Update from the LinkedIn Security Team
description: Members trust LinkedIn with their data and we work to protect that trust.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Introducing a New Era for Sales Navigator
description: Sales Navigator has always been there to help you prospect, but we are adding new functionality to help sales teams expand existing customer relationships, acquire new business and maximize sales productivity.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: August LinkedIn Workforce Report: Data Science Skills are in High Demand Across Industries
description: This month, we’re looking at the increased demand for data scientists as data science skills shortages spread beyond the finance and tech industries. Just three years ago, there was a national surplus of people with data science skills — an employer in Dallas or Atlanta who wanted to hire a data scientist had plenty of options since there were few local shortages. But as more industries turn to big data, the national shortage has grown to 151,717 people, based on employer hiring demand. The U.S. cities with particularly acute shortages are New York City, the San Francisco Bay Area, and Los Angeles.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn Announces Carousel Ads
description: Today, we’re excited to announce carousel for Sponsored Content, a new way to tell your brand story on LinkedIn. This offering allows you to feature multiple visuals that people can horizontally swipe through while on the LinkedIn feed.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Giving Companies More Ways to Learn with LinkedIn Learning Pro
description: We’re always looking to improve learning experiences for our customers, and after hearing directly from them about needing ways to include more specific and relevant content formats to help increase usage by learners, we are excited to announce the availability of LinkedIn Learning Pro.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Ontario government expands access to LinkedIn’s online learning content to entire province
description: TORONTO – May 3, 2018 – For the first time, students at all 44 universities and colleges in Ontario can benefit from online learning courses available on Lynda.com, a LinkedIn company. Through a collaboration between LinkedIn, eCampusOntario and Ontario’s Ministry of Advanced Education and Skills Development (MAESD) more than one million postsecondary students, faculty and staff in Ontario can now access world-class learning content by Lynda.com.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: May LinkedIn Workforce Report: Tax burdens drive many to move across the country
description: This month we're taking a look at tax burdens in states where we've seen migration trends influenced by income, sales and property taxes. Though there's a correlation between states with lower taxes and states that more people are moving to, the states with the very lowest tax burdens aren’t the top attractors in terms of migration inflows. Instead, the cities gaining the most people are those rich in economic opportunities – with strong hiring and relatively affordable housing, according to the May LinkedIn Workforce Report.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: UK LinkedIn Workforce Report: Britain losing talent since Brexit vote
description: LinkedIn’s sixth UK Workforce Report reveals that the UK has become less attractive as a destination for international talent, as in Q1 of 2018, it lost more professionals to the 27-member nations of the EU (EU27) than it gained from them. Migration has been steadily falling since the UK voted for Brexit, and LinkedIn’s data reveals that the number of professionals arriving to the UK from the EU27 has decreased by 26 percent over the last year.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn signs Detroit office lease
description: Last August we shared that LinkedIn would be opening its first new U.S office in 10 years, in Detroit, Michigan. In October, with 13 employees on board, we moved into a temporary space. Fast forward five months and our local team has grown to nearly 40 employees.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: April Workforce Report: San Francisco continues to be talent magnet
description: Despite its steep housing prices and long commute times, San Francisco is still a net attracter of talent, with the number of people moving to the San Francisco Bay Area continuing to outweigh the number of people leaving for cities that have lower costs of living, according to the April LinkedIn Workforce Report.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Girl Scouts launches the Girl Scout Network on LinkedIn
description: New York, NY (April 5, 2018)—Today, Girl Scouts of the USA (GSUSA) and LinkedIn launched the Girl Scout Network on LinkedIn. Just a few days before Equal Pay Day on April 10, GSUSA and LinkedIn are manifesting their shared commitment to equal opportunity in an invaluable new career resource that promotes girls’ and women’s empowerment, leadership, and advancement in the world. With the World Economic Forum's Global Gender Gap Report 2017 findings revealing that gender pay parity is still more than 200 years away, the two organizations are taking action to help tip the scales for women in the workplace.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn appoints Jian Lu as president of LinkedIn China
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Introducing video for Sponsored Content and Company Pages
description: Today, we’re excited to announce two major updates that let you use sight, sound and motion to tell more compelling stories: video for Sponsored Content and Company Pages. These offerings build on the momentum of member video, which we launched in August.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: UK LinkedIn Workforce Report: The UK is becoming less attractive as a destination for international talent
description: LinkedIn’s fifth UK Workforce Report reveals that the UK is becoming a less attractive destination for international talent, with a marked slowdown in the number of overseas professionals coming to the UK for work in February. February also saw a fall in hiring, with the majority of regions and sectors seeing a decline in hiring rates compared to January.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn to open second office in Germany
description: We’re thrilled to announce that the eleventh LinkedIn office in EMEA will be in Berlin, Germany. This reflects the significant momentum LinkedIn has experienced in the German-speaking region (Germany, Austria and Switzerland) and our ambitions for future growth.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn Dream Jobs launches in Indonesia
description: We all know that landing the right job is crucial for everyone, especially young people who are just getting started in their careers.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn unveils third annual Top Companies list
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Introducing Ask for a Referral on LinkedIn Jobs
description: Referrals are one of the best ways to get your foot in the door at a company. In fact, the No. 1 way that job seekers have reported first discovering a job was through someone they knew. To help our members land their next opportunity, we’ve introduced Ask for a Referral – making it even easier to find the way in.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn reveals the latest talent turnover trends
description: Today, LinkedIn Talent Solutions revealed the roles, industries and sectors experiencing the highest turnover rates, worldwide. The findings, based on a new analysis of more than half a billion LinkedIn member profiles, show that the tech, retail, and media sectors are seeing the highest turnover rates, while the average turnover rate for all companies around the world is 10.9 percent.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: March Workforce Report: Jobs gain keep momentum
description: February saw a steady number of jobs added to the U.S. economy, up 20 percent year-over-year, according to the March LinkedIn Workforce Report. Hiring in the aerospace, automotive and transportation industries saw the biggest year-over-year increases, followed by architecture and engineering, and financial service and insurance.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: New Report shows talent development is playing an increasingly strategic role in today’s economy
description: Today, LinkedIn Learning published the 2018 Workplace Learning Report, which surveyed more than 4,000 professionals: 1,200 talent development professionals, 2,200 employees, 200 executives and 400 people managers.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: February Workforce Report: Manufacturing drives robust January hiring
description: Hiring across the U.S. in January was higher than it has been since May 2017, with the manufacturing sector seeing the biggest year-over-year growth, according to the February LinkedIn Workforce Report.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Resume Assistant now generally available for Office 365 subscribers
description: Last year, we previewed Resume Assistant, which integrates the power of LinkedIn directly into Microsoft word to help job-seekers create their most compelling resume yet. Today, we’re announcing the general availability of Resume Assistant to Office 365 subscribers on Windows in select regions including:
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Sales Navigator grows up and plays well with others
description: Over the past 3 years, Sales Navigator has evolved from an extension of LinkedIn into a separate product and one of the industry’s fastest growing enterprise-grade SaaS applications. Today, more than 80% of the Forbes Cloud 100 use Sales Navigator to meet their revenue goals.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: UK LinkedIn Workforce Report: Hiring falls amid tight labour market
description: LinkedIn’s latest UK Workforce report reveals a continued fall in hiring in the United Kingdom. The hiring rate in December 2017 was 4 percent lower than the month before, suggesting that the U.K. ended 2017 with a slowing labour market.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn 2018 Report Highlights Top Global Trends in Recruiting
description: To give your recruiting strategy a boost for the new year, LinkedIn Talent Solutions has released its Global Recruiting Trends 2018: The 4 Ideas Changing How You Hire report, including insights from 8,800+ recruiters and hiring managers on how the topics of diversity, new interview methods, data and artificial intelligence, are impacting recruiting today.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: January Workforce Report: Hiring rates in Sunbelt cities greater than San Francisco and Manhattan
description: 2017 ended on a strong note with hiring up 24 percent in December than the previous year, according to LinkedIn’s January Workforce Report. Employers added the most jobs in the financial services and insurance industry, followed by aerospace, automotive and transportation and architecture and engineering. Seasonally-adjusted hiring (hiring that excludes seasonal hiring variations) was 0.7 percent lower in December than November 2017.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn data reveals the skills companies need most
description: The workforce is changing, and that means professionals need to continue learning new skills to stay ahead. To start the new year off right, we have identified the hard and soft skills companies need most.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: UK Workforce Report: British hiring slows down
description: Hiring in the UK was 10 percent lower in November 2017 than in October 2017, according to LinkedIn’s December UK Workforce Report. The findings reveal that the recent boom in British jobs has been interrupted.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: New report uncovers the factors driving contractor growth
description: Together with the Adecco Group, LinkedIn recently released the report, Flexible Working: A Career and Lifestyle Pathway, which uncovers what motivates professionals to engage in flexible work.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn Workforce Report: Year in Review
description: For our last U.S. LinkedIn Workforce Report of the year, we’re taking a look at what 2017 looked like in terms of hiring, the industries that created the most jobs, and which cities lost the most and gained the most workers.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: New LinkedIn notifications on trending skills
description: Staying on top of emerging skills and highlighting your strengths is important to connecting to new opportunities, regardless of what industry work in. To give you more insight into in-demand skills, we’ve launched a new monthly notification that shares relevant trending skills among people with your same job title. If you already have this skill, consider adding it to your LinkedIn Profile -- skills are one of the top ways that recruiters search for candidates on LinkedIn.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn's 2017 U.S. Emerging Jobs Report
description: It’s no secret that the job landscape over the past five years has changed, so today we published the 2017 Emerging Jobs Report with insights into the up-and-coming roles in the U.S. job market and the skills it takes to land them.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Report: Workforce location linked to increased productivity and profits
description: New research from a collaboration between LinkedIn and EY has found that companies can make major performance and productivity improvements by taking a more strategic approach to where they place their people.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn partners with Tsinghua University to publish the China Digital Economy Talent Report
description: The strength of the Chinese economy and the integration of technology into traditional industries have become important new driving forces of China’s economic growth, with digital talents critical to China’s digital transformation. To help the government and the industries be more informed about digital talents, the Tsinghua SEM Center for Internet Development and Governance (CIDG) collaborated with LinkedIn to publish the first-ever China Digital Economy Talent Report.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: New LinkedIn research shows 75 percent of 25-33 year olds have experienced quarter-life crises

This new data shows that 75 percent of 25-33 year olds have experienced a quarter-life crisis, with the average age being 27.

title: Investing in skills that’ll go the distance
description: Fifty years ago, work in developed countries was often defined by relative certainties. Aside from the periodic recession, many nations were at or near full employment. Rapid productivity growth was underpinning an improvement in living standards. A university degree was a meal ticket to a high-paying, secure job as a professional. And for workers with a high school diploma, jobs on manufacturing assembly lines offered a pathway to middle-class prosperity and upward mobility. While this was not necessarily the reality everywhere, it was the model that set expectations for what a career was supposed to look like.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: September Workforce Report: Hiring remains strong through August
description: The summer showed no slowdown of job creation, as hiring across the U.S. was 7.2 percent higher this August than it was a year ago, according to the September LinkedIn Workforce Report. One exception to the positive national trend was in the Houston metro area between Aug 27 and Aug 30 during Hurricane Harvey -- Houston saw a sharp decline in hiring compared to normal levels.

description: First impressions happen in the blink of an eye – they’re crucial when it comes to the job hunt and can help you find your way in. In fact, nearly 80 percent of professionals find it difficult to overcome a bad first impression according to a LinkedIn study. It’s important to present yourself in a way that highlights what makes you stand out as a professional. Whether it’s your first interview or your first day at your new job, here are some dos and don'ts to keep in mind:
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

description: The number of Britain’s entrepreneurs, sole traders and SMEs is on the rise while Britain’s biggest companies are reducing the size of their workforces, according to the latest LinkedIn research based on a pool of LinkedIn’s 23 million UK members between April 2016 and April 2017.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: New LinkedIn desktop app for Windows 10
description: Every month millions of professionals around the world access LinkedIn using a web browser on Windows 10. We want to give these members more options for how they connect with their professional world, so today we’re excited to share that we are starting to roll out our LinkedIn app for Windows 10. With our new desktop application, Windows 10 users can enjoy a richer, more engaging and connected LinkedIn experience.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

description: U.S. employers continued to add more workers to their payroll in June. In fact, May and June were the strongest months for hiring since summer 2015, according to the July LinkedIn Workforce Report.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: How millennials network: New LinkedIn data
description: Millennials are already the largest generation in the workforce, making up more than one-third of those employed today. By 2020, they’ll grow to represent more than 50 percent of the workforce. Much has been written about this generation’s defining traits: purpose-driven, digitally-savvy, and extremely well-connected. But how connected are they really?
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: New LinkedIn Notifications and settings to give members more control
description: The Notifications tab on LinkedIn is where you get timely and relevant updates about your network, and see activity about you, the content you’ve shared, and your connections. Notifications can help start a conversation and spark new career opportunities — we show you job listings you may be interested in, updates when someone you know starts a new position, details on who you’re meeting with next, and much more.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: LinkedIn data finds animation, computer networking are industries where your network matters most
description: We analyzed LinkedIn data to find the industries where your professional network matters most - and least - and the results may surprise you. Industries where highly specialized training was required saw the most professionals tapping their network to land the job, including animation, computer networking, and semiconductors. On the flipside, industries that rely less on their professional networks include a variety of medical fields and more creative professions.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Piloting LinkedIn Gigs, an easy way to connect to gig work
description: At LinkedIn, our vision is to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce — not just those in traditional 9-to-5 jobs. With that in mind, we began a project last year to learn how we can play a role in the on-demand gig economy, one of the fastest growing segments of the labor market.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Eighty-percent of professionals consider networking important to career success
description: According to new LinkedIn global survey results, almost 80 percent of professionals consider professional networking to be important to career success. Not only that, but 70 percent of people in 2016 were hired at a company where they had a connection. Despite the importance of networking, the survey revealed gaps in how professionals feel vs. their behavior and how they stay in touch with their network. Here’s what we found:

The introduction of these two features reinforces our commitment to bring job seekers and companies closer together making LinkedIn a destination for all things jobs.

title: Announcing LinkedIn's grad guide
description: It’s graduation season, which means there are thousands of graduates getting ready to embark on their career journey. The fact remains that many of them don’t know where to start their job search, and that’s where we come in. To help recent graduates take the first step in their professional career, we’ve gathered insights on the best time to apply to get hired, the cities, industries and companies hiring the most students, and some of the highest paying entry level jobs in the country.
author: LinkedIn Corporate Communications

title: Introducing smarter messaging on LinkedIn
